title: 2003–04 Serie B
text:
The 2003–04 <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> is the 72nd season since its establishment in 1929. It is the second highest <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> league in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>.
Teams.
<a href="Treviso%20Calcio">Treviso</a>, <a href="US%20Avellino">Avellino</a>, <a href="AlbinoLeffe">AlbinoLeffe</a> and <a href="Pescara%20Calcio">Pescara</a> had been promoted from <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a>, while <a href="Atalanta%20BC">Atalanta</a>, <a href="Piacenza%20Calcio">Piacenza</a>, <a href="Calcio%20Como">Como</a>, and <a href="Torino%20FC">Torino</a> had been relegated from <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a>. Following the <a href="Caso%20Catania">Caso Catania</a>, <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">Fiorentina</a> was added.
Events.
Following the <a href="Caso%20Catania">Caso Catania</a>, the league had been expanded to 24 clubs, and six special promotions were decided to descend to 22.
Relegation play-offs were also introduced.
Final classification.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Promotion play-offs.
<a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">Fiorentina</a> had to play a qualification match with 15th-placed team of <a href="Serie%20A%202003-04">Serie A</a>, <a href="Perugia%20Calcio">Perugia</a>.
<a href="Perugia%20Calcio">A.C. Perugia</a> relegated to <a href="Serie%20B%202004-05">Serie B</a>, while <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">ACF Fiorentina</a> was promoted to <a href="Serie%20A%202004-05">Serie A</a>.
Relegation play-off.
<a href="A.S.%20Bari">A.S. Bari</a> was relegated to <a href="Serie%20C1%202004-05">Serie C1 2004-05</a> but was later readmitted to Serie B in place of <a href="S.S.C.%20Napoli">S.S.C. Napoli</a>.
